description: From Middle English gliteren, from Old Norse glitra, from Proto-Germanic *glitrōną (“to glitter”), from Proto-Indo-European *ǵʰley-.

entries.meaning: A bright, sparkling light; shininess or brilliance.
A shiny, decorative adornment, sometimes sprinkled on glue to make simple artwork.

verbs.description: glitter (third-person singular simple present glitters, present participle glittering, simple past and past participle glittered)

entries.meaning: To sparkle with light; to shine with a brilliant and broken light or showy luster; to gleam.
examples: the glittering ornaments on a Christmas tree

entries.meaning: To be showy, specious, or striking, and hence attractive.
examples: the glittering scenes of a court
